page.title: 15FOOTPATHS
page.content: (Gibbins Lane - Jealotts Hill) The footpath is potholed with gravel at the start and then varies between fields, ordinary road and farm track. Footpath boundaries consist mostly of hedgerows, wooden fences and land use in surrounding fields is either hay, cereals or grass. The path runs close to Warfield Church and several private houses. (Hill Farm-Allanbay Park) The first part of the route is metalled track with several houses en route. At Hill Farm the footpath becomes grassy and later quite muddy. The bridle path is only 1metre wide with hedgerows and trees. Rabbits and squirrels are common and surrounding fields are mostly agricultural.
